text:

trans:
Given that it is difficult to clearly diagnose the High Low's cause (different hoof shapes on the left and right), we can try to work on the musculature. This may simply be linked to laterality (being left- or right-handed), which is perfectly normal.
The specific work needs to be discussed with a specialist, since each horse is unique in its physical features, musculature and so on. Physiotherapists are among the most effective, but I know very few at present.
I totally corrected my horse's asymmetry with training. So it is possible ğŸ˜‰
During the remusculation/symmetrization phase, you can also use wedges by a specialist, as this is very counter-intuitive.
